title: Anti-Money Laundering Policy - High Risk Jurisdictions
content: This policy establishes requirements for transactions involving high-risk jurisdictions. Transactions exceeding $10,000 USD to or from countries designated as high-risk (including Iran, North Korea, Syria, Cuba, and Venezuela) must undergo enhanced due diligence. All such transactions require: (1) Additional customer verification, (2) Source of funds documentation, (3) Purpose of transaction justification, (4) Senior management approval. Transactions with these jurisdictions that show unusual patterns, lack clear business purpose, or involve shell companies must be flagged for immediate review by the compliance team. The institution must maintain records of all flagged transactions for a minimum of 7 years.
